bptfm.help: Same as bptf but does not remove mean (emulates fslmaths < 5.0.7)

bwlabel.help: Connected component labelling for non-zero voxels (conn sets neighbors: 6, 18, 26)

ceil.help: round voxels upwards to the nearest integer

ras.help: reorder and flip dimensions to RAS orientation

conform.help: reslice to 1mm size in coronal slice direction with 256^3 voxels

comply.help: conform to axial slice with dx*dy*dzmm size and dx*dy*dz voxels. f_high bright clamping (0.98 for top 2%). Linear (1) or nearest-neighbor (0)

crop.help: remove volumes, starts with 0 not 1! Inputting -1 for a size will set it to the full range

dehaze.help: set dark voxels to zero (mode 1..5; higher yields more surviving voxels)

detrend.help: remove linear trend (and mean) from input

demean.help: remove average signal across volumes (requires 4D input)

edt.help: estimate Euler Distance Transform (distance field). Assumes isotropic input

close.help: morphological close that binarizes with `thr`, dilates with `dx1` and erodes with `dx2` (fills bubbles with `thr`)

floor.help: round voxels downwards to the nearest integer

gz.help: NIfTI gzip mode (0=uncompressed, 1=compressed, else FSL environment; default -1)

h2c.help: convert CT scans from 'Hounsfield' to 'Cormack' units to emphasize soft tissue contrast

mesh.help: meshify requires 'd'ark, 'm'edium, 'b'right or numeric isosurface ('niimath bet -mesh -i d mesh.gii')

mod.help: modulus fractional remainder - same as '-rem' but includes fractions

otsu.help: binarize image using Otsu's method (mode 1..5; higher yields more bright voxels)

power.help: raise the current image by following exponent

p.help: set maximum number of parallel threads. DISABLED: recompile for OpenMP support

round.help: round voxels to the nearest integer

tensor_2lower.help: convert FSL style upper triangle image to NIfTI standard lower triangle order

tensor_2upper.help: convert NIfTI standard lower triangle image to FSL style upper triangle order

tensor_decomp_lower.help: as tensor_decomp except input stores lower diagonal (AFNI, ANTS, Camino convention)

trunc.help: truncates the decimal value from floating point value and returns integer value

unsharp.help: edge enhancing unsharp mask (sigma in mm, not voxels [1 is typical]; scl is amount [0.5 medium, 1.0 heavy])

dog.help: difference of gaussian with zero-crossing edges (positive and negative sigma mm)

dogr.help: as dog, without zero-crossing (raw rather than binarized data)

dogx.help: as dog, zero-crossing for 2D sagittal slices

dogy.help: as dog, zero-crossing for 2D coronal slices

dogz.help: as dog, zero-crossing for 2D axial slices

add.help: add following input to current image

sub.help: subtract following input from current image

mul.help: multiply current image by following input

div.help: divide current image by following input

rem.help: modulus remainder - divide current image by following input and take remainder

mas.help: use (following image>0) to mask current image

thr.help: use following number to threshold current image (zero anything below the number)

thrp.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to threshold current image (zero anything below the number)

thrP.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE of non-zero voxels and threshold below

uthr.help: use following number to upper-threshold current image (zero anything above the number)

uthrp.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to upper-threshold current image (zero anything above the number)

uthrP.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE of non-zero voxels and threshold above

clamp.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to threshold current image (anything below set to this threshold)

uclamp.help: use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to threshold current image (anything above set to this threshold)

max.help: take maximum of following input and current image

min.help: take minimum of following input and current image

seed.help: seed random number generator with following number

restart.help: replace the current image with input for future processing operations

save.help: save the current working image to the input filename

inm.help: (-i i ip.c) intensity normalisation (per 3D volume mean)

ing.help: (-I i ip.c) intensity normalisation, global 4D mean)

s.help: create a gauss kernel of sigma mm and perform mean filtering

binv.help: binarise and invert (binarisation and logical inversion)

fillh.help: fill holes in a binary mask (holes are internal - i.e. do not touch the edge of the FOV)

index.help: replace each nonzero voxel with a unique (subject to wrapping) index number

grid.help: add a 3D grid of intensity <value> with grid spacing <spacing>

tfce.help: enhance with TFCE, e.g. -tfce 2 0.5 6 (maybe change 6 to 26 for skeletons)

nanm.help: make NaN (improper number) mask with 1 for NaN voxels, 0 otherwise

range.help: set the output calmin/max to full data range

tensor_decomp.help: convert a 4D (6-timepoint )tensor image into L1,2,3,FA,MD,MO,V1,2,3 (remaining image in pipeline is FA)

3D.help: 3x3x3 box centered on target voxel (set as default kernel)

box.help: all voxels in a cube of width <size> mm centered on target voxel

boxv.help: all voxels in a cube of width <size> voxels centered on target voxel, CAUTION: size should be an odd number

boxv3.help: all voxels in a cuboid of dimensions X x Y x Z centered on target voxel, CAUTION: size should be an odd number

gauss.help: gaussian kernel (sigma in mm, not voxels)

sphere.help: all voxels in a sphere of radius <size> mm centered on target voxel

dilD.help: Maximum Dilation of non-zero voxels (emulating output of fslmaths 6.0.1, max not modal)

dilall.help: Apply -dilM repeatedly until the entire FOV is covered

ero.help: Erode by zeroing non-zero voxels when zero voxels found in kernel

fmean.help: Mean filtering, kernel weighted (conventionally used with gauss kernel)

fmeanu.help: Mean filtering, kernel weighted, un-normalized (gives edge effects)

subsamp2.help: downsamples image by a factor of 2 (keeping new voxels centered on old)

subsamp2offc.help: downsamples image by a factor of 2 (non-centered)

Tmaxn.help: time index of max across time

Tperc.help: nth percentile (0-100) of FULL RANGE across time

Tar1.help: temporal AR(1) coefficient (use -odt float and probably demean first)

pval.help: Nonparametric uncorrected P-value, assuming timepoints are the permutations; first timepoint is actual (unpermuted) stats image

pval0.help: Same as -pval, but treat zeros as missing data

cpval.help: Same as -pval, but gives FWE corrected P-values

ztopc.help: Convert Z-stat to (uncorrected but clamped) P

ptozc.help: Convert (uncorrected but clamped) P to Z

rank.help: Convert data to ranks (over T dim)

ranknorm.help: Transform to Normal dist via ranks

roi.help: zero outside roi (using voxel coordinates). Inputting -1 for a size will set it to the full image extent for that dimension

bptf.help: (-t in ip.c) Bandpass temporal filtering; nonlinear highpass and Gaussian linear lowpass (with sigmas in volumes, not seconds); set either sigma<0 to skip that filter

roc.help: take (normally binary) truth and test current image in ROC analysis against truth. <AROC-thresh> is usually 0.05 and is limit of Area-under-ROC measure FP axis. <outfile> is a text file of the ROC curve (triplets of values: FP TP threshold). If the truth image contains negative voxels these get excluded from all calculations. If <AROC-thresh> is positive then the [4Dnoiseonly] option needs to be set, and the FP rate is determined from this noise-only data, and is set to be the fraction of timepoints where any FP (anywhere) is seen, as found in the noise-only 4d-dataset. This is then controlling the FWE rate. If <AROC-thresh> is negative the FP rate is calculated from the zero-value parts of the <truth> image, this time averaging voxelwise FP rate over all timepoints. In both cases the TP rate is the average fraction of truth=positive voxels correctly found
